Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Technique: ENAMELLED; ENGRAVED; PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL
Name: Scarab
Description: Very simplified small scarab: the head and the clypeus are stylised, the prothorax is alluded to by two lateral lines, and the crenellated legs are indicated by vertical hatching. The flat surface is engraved with a rather common motif, Nefer Re (''Re is perfect''), surrounded by round spirals.
